traits.name: abrasive
traits.description: Pawn always says exactly what's on his mind, especially if it's bugging him. That tends to rub people the wrong way.

traits.name: absent-minded
traits.description:
Pawn tends to occasionally allow their mind to drift, even in the middle of working.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: academian
traits.description:
Whether through studying ancient manuscripts or years of scholastic pursuit Pawn is surprisingly well read on a variety of topics, particularly science and medical practice.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: animalhater
traits.description:
Pawn believes deeply in human superiority. Killing animals will please them and the colony losing an animal is a cherry on top according to them.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: animallover
traits.description:
Pawn can't stand mistreatment of animals. he will feel happier being nuzzled or being a master to a bonded animal, but will be more deeply crushed when not master of a bonded animal or seeing one die. They also refuse to butcher.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: annoyingvoice
traits.description: Pawn's voice has a particularly grating, nasal quality to it, and he tends to talk in barked, garbled phrases. This predisposes others to dislike him.

traits.name: anxious
traits.description:
Pawn feels naturally anxious, but especially from social situations. They will not attend any gatherings and may occasionally need alone time in their room to breathe.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: ascetic
traits.description: Pawn has forsaken physical comforts and enjoyments in favor of a simple, pure lifestyle. he will become unhappy if if he has a bedroom that's too impressive. he also dislikes fancy food and prefers to eat raw. he never judges others by their appearance.

traits.name: asexual
traits.description:
Pawn is uninterested in romantic entanglements.
((RF) Rational Romance (Continued))

traits.name: beautiful
traits.description: Pawn is exceptionally beautiful, with an exotic-yet-familiar facial structure and an arresting gaze. People are attracted to him before he even opens his mouth.

traits.name: big-boned
traits.description:
Whether because they're a bit chunky or because they shift their weight oddly, Pawn has broken a few chairs in their time and is likely to break more.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: bisexual
traits.description:
Pawn is romantically attracted to people regardless of gender.
((RF) Rational Romance (Continued))

traits.name: bloodlust
traits.description: Pawn gets a rush from hurting people, and never minds the sight of blood or death. he is four times as likely to start a social fight as others.

traits.name: bodypurist
traits.description: Pawn believes the human body is limited for a reason. To him, artificial body parts are unethical and disgusting.

traits.name: brave
traits.description:
Pawn has a higher mental and physical fortitude compared to most and can more readily adapt to harsh environments in the rimworlds.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: brawler
traits.description: Pawn likes to fight up close and personal. his accuracy is greatly increased in melee combat, but he'll be very unhappy if asked to carry a ranged weapon.

traits.name: cannibal
traits.description: Pawn was taught that eating human meat is wrong and horrible. But one time, long ago, he tried it... and he liked it.

traits.name: carefulshooter
traits.description: Pawn takes more time to aim when shooting. he shoots less often than others, but with more accuracy.

traits.name: catperson
traits.description:
Pawn is mad for all things feline. They will naturally gravitate towards bonding with cats, however they're not a fan of dogs.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: chemicalfascination
traits.description: Pawn is utterly fascinated with chemical sources of enjoyment. Consuming recreational drugs will create a good mood, while abstaining will lead to increasing frustration over time and possibly drug binges. he will ignore directives to not use recreational drugs, and will consume more than a normal person.

traits.name: chemicalinterest
traits.description: Pawn has an unusual interest in chemical sources of enjoyment. Consuming recreational drugs will create a good mood, while abstaining will lead to increasing frustration over time and possible drug binges. he will ignore directives to not use recreational drugs, and will consume more than a normal person.

traits.name: clumsy
traits.description:
Minor bruises and scrapes plague Pawn all too often, mostly due to uncoordinated tripping or falling.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: coldinclined
traits.description:
Pawn loves the overcast and cold of a brisk winter night. They don't mind getting chilly or sleeping in the cold either.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: couchpotato
traits.description:
An armchair and flatscreen is all Pawn needs to be happy. Even reruns or ancient commercials are entertaining to them, they will never grow bored of television and tend to watch it more, as well as feel pleased after doing so.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: coward
traits.description:
While fully capable of warfare in theory, Pawn's fight or flight instincts heavily lean towards flight, and he will try to hide or run as a first priority.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: creepybreathing
traits.description: Pawn breathes heavily all the time, and sweats constantly. People find it creepy.

traits.name: depressive
traits.description: Pawn is perenially unhappy. he has trouble sustaining a good mood even when everything is fine.

traits.name: desensitized
traits.description:
Pawn is hardened through what can only be presumed as old emotional trauma. They feel absolutely nothing from lost animals, colonists, family, prisoners or dead bodies.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: dogperson
traits.description:
Pawn is mad for all things canine. They will naturally gravitate towards bonding with dogs, however they're not a fan of cats.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: drunkenmaster
traits.description:
Pawn is supposedly a hand-to-hand combat specialist, but only when inebriated. They claim to become more talented the more drunk they are.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: dunce
traits.description:
Pawn has hindered mental capacities. While slow to learn and hard to speak with, they tend to be much happier naturally.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: eccentric
traits.description:
Pawn has a loose screw or two, a small trade off for being naturally scientifically inclined.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: ecologist
traits.description:
Flora and fauna are both vital to Pawn. They use all parts of plants and animals and strongly appreciate mother Gaia's blessings.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: faithful
traits.description:
Pawn will never cheat on a partner, no matter how bad the relationship gets.
((RF) Rational Romance (Continued))

traits.name: fastlearner
traits.description: Pawn has a knack for learning. he picks things up much faster than others.

traits.name: fastwalker
traits.description: Pawn likes to be where he's going. he walks quicker than most people.

traits.name: fisherman
traits.description:
Pawn enjoys the solitude and tranquility inherent to long fishing sessions. he will prefer fishing above other activities.
(Vanilla Fishing Expanded)

traits.name: fun-loving
traits.description:
Pawn always recalls the good times and lives to party, any party attended will be remembered for many times longer than most.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: gastronomist
traits.description:
In the eyes of Pawn food is art, their culinary creations are incredibly beautiful, amazing to taste, and almost always safe to eat.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: gay
traits.description:
Pawn is romantically attracted to people of his own gender.
((RF) Rational Romance (Continued))

traits.name: gourmand
traits.description: Pawn's life revolves around food. he gets hungry quickly, and will occasionally be overcome with the urge to eat ravenously, even when not hungry.

traits.name: greatmemory
traits.description: Pawn has a fantastic memory for detail. he will learn new skills slightly faster than other people.

traits.name: greedy
traits.description: Pawn needs a really impressive bedroom. he gets a mood loss if he doesn't get what he wants.

traits.name: groundbreaker
traits.description:
Pawn strongly believes infrastucture rules all and is a natural born stoneworker.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: hardworker
traits.description: Pawn is a natural hard worker and will finish tasks faster than most.

traits.name: hateshumanity
traits.description:
Pawn has a deep hatred toward all of humanity, seeing them as nothing more than egotistical meatbags.
(Android tiers)

traits.name: heatinclined
traits.description:
Pawn loves the brightness and heat of a dry summer day. They don't mind working up a sweat or sleeping in the warmth either.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: heavysleeper
traits.description:
A bomb could go off next to Pawn while they sleep and they'd continue to do so. They can't be bothered to defend the colony mid catnap, either.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: industrious
traits.description: Pawn has an easy time staying on-task and focused, and gets things done much faster than the average person.

traits.name: insatiable
traits.description:
No amount of lovin' is enough lovin' for Pawn. he will tend to jump from partner to partner and tumble between the sheets with them frequently.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: insomniac
traits.description:
Pawn is never really asleep or awake. he is almost zombie like, lurching along and working very slowly, and will only sleep once every three days or so.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: intolerance
traits.description:
Pawn is intolerant of all lifeforms, whether they be mechanical or biological. There is always a chance they will randomly cause fights, especially when their mood is low.
(Android tiers)

traits.name: ironstomach
traits.description:
Pawn has never felt nausea in his life. Throwing up or food poisoning is foreign to him.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: iron-willed
traits.description: Pawn's will is an iron shield. he keeps going through thick and thin, when others broke down long before.

traits.name: jealous
traits.description: For Pawn, it's degrading to have a less impressive bedroom than someone else. he gets a mood loss if any colonist has a more impressive bedroom.

traits.name: jogger
traits.description: Pawn always moves with a sense of urgency - so much so that others often fail to keep up.

traits.name: kind
traits.description: Pawn is exceptionally kind. he has a special way of using kind words to brighten someone's day. he never insults others, and never judges people by their appearance.

traits.name: kleptomaniac
traits.description:
Pawn is compulsed to steal and take things that don't belong to them, even if it means angering the other party.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: lazy
traits.description: Pawn is a little bit lazy.

traits.name: loveshumanity
traits.description:
Pawn has a deep fondness toward all humans, seeing them as not only their own creators but as parental figures.
(Android tiers)

traits.name: lush
traits.description:
Alcohol culture is just part of life for Pawn. he absolutely adores booze and would rather die before giving it up.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: madsurgeon
traits.description:
Pawn has a twisted secret. he treats organ harvesting like a sick experiment, and does not even blink at the idea. While harvesting one will make them happy, going too long without giving in to their compulsion will upset them.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: martialartist
traits.description:
Pawn learned a specific move in melee combat which allows them to disarm opponents and will use it frequently.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: masochist
traits.description: For Pawn, there's something exciting about getting hurt. he doesn't know why, he's just wired differently.

traits.name: mech
traits.description:
A mechanized infantry unit, they do not think or feel.
(Android tiers)

traits.name: menagerist
traits.description:
Pawn believes animals are integral to the way society and life functions from furry friends to sources of food. They love having as many as possible and are particularly good at taming and training them.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: misandrist
traits.description: Pawn really dislikes and distrusts men.

traits.name: misogynist
traits.description: Pawn really dislikes and distrusts women.

traits.name: mountainlover
traits.description:
The mountains call to Pawn. he feels happier just being near a large mountain.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: neat
traits.description:
Pawn is naturally hygenic and organized. They will not track in dirt or throw trash anywhere, and feel happy while cleaning.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: nervous
traits.description: Pawn tends to crack under pressure.

traits.name: neurotic
traits.description: Pawn likes to have things squared away. he will work harder than most to attain this state of affairs, but his nerves can get the better of him.

traits.name: nightowl
traits.description:
Pawn likes to be up during the night, and sleep during the day.

he gets a mood bonus if awake at night (23h-6h) and mood loss if awake during the day (11h-18h).

he doesn't get a mood penalty for being in the dark.

traits.name: nimble
traits.description: Pawn has remarkable kinesthetic intelligence. he seems to dance around danger with preternatural grace.

traits.name: nudist
traits.description: Pawn enjoys the feeling of freedom that comes from being nude. he can handle clothing, but will be happier without it.

traits.name: oceanlover
traits.description:
The sea calls to Pawn. he feels happier just being near the ocean or a deep river.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: optimist
traits.description: Pawn is naturally optimistic about life. It's hard to get him down.

traits.name: perfectionist
traits.description:
Pawn strives for perfection in his work. They will naturally produce better quality products at the expense of time. However, making a low quality product will upset them. Additionally, they may very rarely quit a project mid attempt if they don't like the direction its going in.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: pessimist
traits.description: Pawn tends to look on the bad side of life.

traits.name: philanderer
traits.description:
Pawn just cannot be trusted to stay faithful to a partner.
((RF) Rational Romance (Continued))

traits.name: polyamorous
traits.description:
Pawn prefers romantic relationships involving multiple partners to monogamous relationships. he doesn't mind if his partners romance other people, but will be less happy in a restraining, monogamous relationship.
((RF) Rational Romance (Continued))

traits.name: pretty
traits.description: Pawn has a pretty face, which predisposes people to like him.

traits.name: prodigy
traits.description:
Pawn is a natural scientist. They research much faster and recall things better. However, they'll be upset without a laboratory dedicated to their work and tend to stress out more frequently.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: prude
traits.description:
Pawn refuses to give their body to anybody but their spouse and would never fathom initiating a divorce. They also hate being nude much more than other pawns.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: psychicallydeaf
traits.description: Pawn's mind works on a psychic frequency different from everyone else. he just isn't affected by psychic phenomena.

traits.name: psychicallydull
traits.description: Pawn's mind is psychically out of tune with others. he isn't as affected by psychic phenomena.

traits.name: psychicallyhypersensitive
traits.description: Pawn's mind is like a psychic tuning fork. he is extremely sensitive to psychic phenomena.

traits.name: psychicallysensitive
traits.description: Pawn's mind is unusually sensitive to psychic phenomena.

traits.name: psychopath
traits.description: Pawn has no empathy. The suffering of others doesn't bother him at all. he doesn't mind if others are butchered, left unburied, imprisoned, or sold to slavery - unless it affects him. he also feels no mood boost from socializing.

traits.name: pyromaniac
traits.description: Pawn loves fire. he will never extinguish fires. To relieve stress, he will occasionally go on random fire starting sprees. This happens more often if his mood is low.

traits.name: quickreflexes
traits.description:
Pawn reflexes are truly out of this world. They can parry melee attacks without any training and with luck even bullets.
(Supreme Melee (Continued))

traits.name: quicksleeper
traits.description: Pawn doesn't need as much sleep as the average person. Whether he's sleeping on a bed or on the ground, he will be fully rested in about two thirds the usual time.

traits.name: rebel
traits.description:
Pawn only plays by their own rules, and will roll their eyes and take it easy while doing any task they've been forced to do.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: refinedpalate
traits.description:
Only the finest of culinary creations may grace the lips of Pawn. They feel neutral towards mundane meals, but will laud and savour lavish meals down to the last bite.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: sanguine
traits.description: Pawn is just naturally upbeat about his situation, pretty much all the time, no matter what it is.

traits.name: schizoid
traits.description:
Pawn has trouble expressing themselves until its all too much to bear, whereafter they will have an utter meltdown.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: sickly
traits.description: Pawn has an awful immune system. he gets sick more often than usual, frequently with illnesses that nobody in the colony has been afflicted by.

traits.name: simpleminded
traits.description:
Due to the limitations of this androids mind: they are only barely able to understand and feel emotion. This makes them less than desired in social situations.
(Android tiers)

traits.name: slob
traits.description:
Pawn is sloppy naturally and leaves trash and dirt everywhere it seems. At least they're not much bothered by messes.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: slothful
traits.description: Pawn loves idleness and hates anything productive. he moves slowly and rarely stays focused on a task.

traits.name: slowlearner
traits.description: Pawn is slow on the uptake. he learns much slower than others.

traits.name: slowpoke
traits.description: Pawn is always falling behind the group whenever he goes anywhere.

traits.name: snob
traits.description:
Pawn believes they belong in high society, and loves nothing more than critiquing art and brushing elbows with royalty.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: squeamish
traits.description:
Sour stomach plagues Pawn any time they're around too much blood or rotting corpses. Vomiting is just part of life for he.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: staggeringlyugly
traits.description: Pawn is staggeringly ugly. his face looks like a cross between a drawing by an untalented child, a malformed fetus in a jar of formaldehyde, and a piece of modern art. Others must exert conscious effort to look at him while conversing.

traits.name: steadfast
traits.description: Pawn is mentally tough and won't break down under stresses that would crack most people.

traits.name: stoner
traits.description:
Smokeleaf culture is just part of life for Pawn. he absolutely adores smokeleaf and would rather die before giving it up.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: straight
traits.description:
Pawn is romantically attracted to people of the opposite gender.
((RF) Rational Romance (Continued))

traits.name: submissive
traits.description:
Pawn needs clear instructions on how, and when to do certain things and will only work at a normal speed when being forced to do something.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: super-immune
traits.description: Pawn has a naturally powerful immune system. he will gain immunity much faster than a normal person would, and can survive illnesses that would kill others.

traits.name: technophobe
traits.description:
Whether by past trauma or fear of change, Pawn rejects modernity. They may randomly punch or attack mechanical devices and refuse to learn or research anything about them. They also love killing mechanoids.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: teetotaler

stats: Binging on drug mental state disabled.
Binging on drug mental state disabled.

traits.description: Pawn abhors the idea of gaining pleasure from chemicals. he strictly avoids alcohol and recreational drugs.
stats: Binging on drug mental state disabled.
Binging on drug mental state disabled.

traits.name: thickskinned
traits.description:
Pawn is strangely hypercoagulating and will bleed much more slowly than most.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: thinskinned
traits.description:
Pawn is strangely hemophilic and tends to bleed much more profusely than others.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: toosmart
traits.description: Pawn is too smart for his own good. he learns everything much faster than everyone, but can be quite eccentric.

traits.name: torturedartist
traits.description: Pawn feels alienated and misunderstood by other human beings. he will have a constant mood debuff, but gain a chance (50%) to get a creativity inspiration after a mental break.

traits.name: tough
traits.description: Pawn has thick skin, dense flesh, and durable bones. he takes much less damage than other people from the same blows. he is extremely hard to kill.

traits.name: transcendantreflexes
traits.description:
Pawn reflexes transcends common sense. They can easily parry melee attacks without any training and with a bit of luck even bullets.
(Supreme Melee (Continued))

traits.name: transhumanist
traits.description: Pawn feels limited in his feeble human body. he often dreams of being enhanced by artificial body parts.

traits.name: trigger-happy
traits.description: Pew! Pew! Pew! Pawn just likes pulling the trigger. he shoots faster than others, but less accurately.

traits.name: tycoon
traits.description:
Pawn has an eye for silver and a tongue made from it. They believe their products are the best products and he will likely convince you if given the chance.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: ugly
traits.description: Pawn is somewhat ugly. This subtly repels others during social interactions.

traits.name: undergrounder
traits.description: Pawn has no need to experience the outdoors or light. he will never feel cooped up or get cabin fever, no matter how long he stays inside, and is not bothered by darkness.

traits.name: vengeful
traits.description:
Pawn is fueled by spite. They can't stand walking on the same soil as their rivals and will be elated by news of their life ending.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: veryneurotic
traits.description: Pawn feels constantly nervous about everything that has to get done. he will work extremely hard to attain this state of affairs, but his nerves can easily get the better of him.

traits.name: volatile
traits.description: Pawn is on a hair-trigger all the time. he is the first to break in any tough situation.

traits.name: wanderlust
traits.description:
Pawn loves to travel and does so swiftly, but can grow upset if they haven't done so in a while. They are also quite adept at foraging while traveling.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: wimp
traits.description: Pawn is weak and cowardly. Even a little pain will immobilize him.

traits.name: workaholic
traits.description:
Pawn has problems taking breaks or resting mid job. he will continue to work even sacrificing their health or sleep.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: worldweary
traits.description:
Pawn has grown tired of the world and needs to be constantly distracted to stop dark thoughts. his bleak personality is a big downer and therefore it is very hard to become friends with them.
(Vanilla Traits Expanded)

traits.name: xenophile
traits.description:
Pawn thinks aliens are exotic and interesting. They would love to get to know them more and wouldn't mind forming relationships with them.
(Humanoid Alien Races 2.0)

traits.name: xenophobe
traits.description:
Pawn hates and distrusts xenos. They see them as little more than animals.
(Humanoid Alien Races 2.0)
